intro: Rhododendron tawangense, commonly known as the Tawang rhododendron, is a species native to the eastern Himalayas, particularly in regions of Arunachal Pradesh, India. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows in moist, cool, and shaded forest environments. The plant features dense clusters of showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are dark green, leathery, and elliptical in shape, providing a striking contrast to the vibrant floral display. Rhododendron tawangense plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local biodiversity and contributing to the region's unique flora.
